snippet: The city has increased its inspections of facilities since many more have opened under Mayor Bill de Blasio’s universal prekindergarten program.
abstract: New York City officials, who have increased their inspections of day care centers since many more have opened under Mayor Bill de Blasio's universal prekindergarten program, say there are nine facilities in Brooklyn and on Staten Island that are likely to be closed; criminal charges are brought against four operators after pattern of forged records and neglect was found.
lead_paragraph: The city has increased its inspections of facilities since many more have opened under Mayor Bill de Blasio’s universal prekindergarten program.

headline.main: Charges Brought Against Four Day Care Operators
headline.print_headline: Charges Brought Against Four Day Care Operators
